description: The single largest competitive entrance exam in Pakistan for aspiring doctors, conducted regionally (UHS, DUHS, KMU, etc.) under PMDC regulations, determining admission to public and private medical colleges.
The most prestigious competitive examination in the country conducted by the FPSC, selecting bureaucrats for BS-17 positions in federal groups like PAS, PSP, and FSP.
High-volume recruitment tests conducted by the Punjab Public Service Commission for various provincial BS-14 to BS-17 posts, attracting hundreds of thousands of applicants annually.

The primary recruitment channel for Commissioned Officers in the Pakistan Army, involving an initial academic/physical test followed by the comprehensive Inter-Services Selection Board (ISSB) assessment.
Conducted by the National Testing Service, this is a mandatory prerequisite for M.Phil/PhD admissions and various public/private sector job recruitments across Pakistan.
A highly competitive exam conducted by PPSC specifically for administrative and executive posts within the Punjab provincial government, second only to CSS in difficulty and prestige.
Aggregated screening tests for federal positions in ministries and departments (excluding CSS), covering jobs like Appraising Officers, Section Officers, and Senior Auditors.
Mass recruitment exams conducted by provincial police departments or testing agencies (like NTS/PTS) for law enforcement roles at the district level.
The standard entrance examination for public sector engineering universities, primarily conducted by UET Lahore for Punjab, determining merit for engineering disciplines.
A highly sought-after specific recruitment drive under the FPSC for the Federal Investigation Agency, known for high applicant volume due to the power and perks of the agency.
Large-scale seasonal recruitment tests for teaching positions in government schools, often conducted by NTS or provincial education departments.
A mandatory standardized test conducted by the Higher Education Commission (HEC) for anyone seeking admission to a 5-year LL.B program in Pakistan.
The Combined Competitive Examination conducted by the Sindh Public Service Commission (SPSC) for executive provincial posts, serving as the Sindhi equivalent to CSS/PMS Punjab.
Subject-specific competitive exams for appointing lecturers in government colleges and higher secondary schools, requiring a master's degree in the relevant field.

test_name: ASF (Airport Security Force) Corporal & ASI Tests
description: Physical and written tests for uniform posts in aviation security, popular among intermediate and graduate candidates due to federal benefits.
The primary testing avenue for provincial government jobs in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, ranging from administrative staff to technical specialists.
Recruitment tests for the premier civilian intelligence agency, often conducted directly or via testing services for posts like GD (General Duty) and OM (Office Management).
FPSC-conducted examinations for uniform and non-uniform roles within the Federal Board of Revenue (FBR) Customs department.
A standardized scholastic aptitude test introduced by HEC for undergraduate admissions in universities across Pakistan.
A periodic but intense competition conducted by provincial commissions (PPSC/SPSC) for revenue department administration roles.
A specialized medical entrance exam for Army Medical College and its affiliated combined military hospitals, separate from the general provincial MDCAT.
Screening tests for general vacancies in the Sindh Government, covering diverse departments from Health to Local Government.
Tests conducted by the SIBA Testing Service, currently the preferred body for transparency in Sindh government recruitments (e.g., PST/JEST teachers).
Selection tests for the Pakistan Air Force, focusing on intelligence, physics, and English for induction into the General Duty Pilot or Engineering branches.
Competitive exams for provincial jobs in Balochistan, conducted by the Balochistan Public Service Commission.
Tests for Sub-Inspectors, ASIs, and Constables within the ANF, focusing on drug enforcement roles.
The entrance mechanism for the Pakistan Navy to join as a Permanent Commission officer, involving academic and intelligence testing.
Recruitment tests for gazetted and non-gazetted posts specifically for the government of Azad Jammu & Kashmir.
Open Testing Service and Pakistan Testing Service exams used by various public sector organizations (WAPDA, Railways) for contract and permanent staffing.
Competitive exams for civil administration and functional roles within the semi-autonomous Gilgit-Baltistan region.
